intro: Morisonia oblongifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf morisonia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features palmately lobed leaves and produces showy, pale yellow to white flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Its botanical characteristics make it a distinctive and ecologically important species in its native habitat.
